data.title: lightbuffer (aka brightness and shadow) always comes last as a mul
Editor Toggle hide children broken
data.body: Since version 3.9 the editor options on a SimGroup "Toggle Hide Children" and "Toggle Lock Children" no longer work, nothing happens. Previously in 3.8 it worked and it proberly hid all children objects in the SimGroup.

data.title: Using x64 effectively 'disables' use of intrinsic functions.
data.body:
example :- 
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Engine/source/ts/arch/tsMeshIntrinsics.sse.cpp#L24

There's a few other places where intrinsic functions are disabled, and some are in libraries; It appears to be an oversight in the process of making the x64 version work.

data.title: Fix load with DTS shapes introduced with HW skinning changes
data.body:
Due to a few typos and bad edge cases, meshes which use the following wont load correctly with the HW skinning changes:
- Secondary UV coords
- Colors
- Parented meshes combined with removed meshes
- Loading meshes using a 64bit memory address

This PR fixes this problem.

data.title: Implements the splash screen window to the SDL platform stuff.
data.body: Implements the splash screen window to the SDL platform stuff.

data.title: Removes the unnecessary include of altbase in nativefiledialogs
data.body: Removes the unnecessary include of altbase in nativefiledialogs, which was causing problems with express versions of VS.

data.title: readme in Torque3D-3.9-LinBinaries.tar.gz has links to non-existance wiki
data.body: The readme in Torque3D-3.9-LinBinaries.tar.gz https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/wiki/Project-Manager to read about/download the project manager and that wiki no longer exists

data.title: Changed keyboard layout
data.body:
When I run the game in DirectX 11 mode, then my keyboard layout is changed to US.
For those who do not know how a german keyboard works, it basically switches y and z.
So when I run the game in DirectX 9 z is z and y is y for me, but with DirectX 11 suddenly z is y and y is z, can be quite confusing.
Any ideas why this could be the case?

data.title: address banding
data.body:
reverts the token (passtrhough) buffer back to 8888 from 16Fs
puts the gammaPostFX in 16 bit range to handle gamma input with fewe format-conversion based banding issues. 
Removes 10/2 from getBestHDRFormat to kill another source of conflict.

data.title: short term LOD correction
data.body:
to preserve current widescreen vs 4:3 windows while closer matching prior release results

Long Term we'll likely want to circle back around to https://github.com/Azaezel/Torque3D/commit/10f528280e205b273457b6ae40d35ba3fc95ea39

data.title: adds toLinear and toGamma helper functions for ColorF, uses the former in adjusting lights.
data.body:
_Note this will likely take a second pass once we kill Directx 9 and go all-in on using SGRB buffers
*_All in may end up excluding Mac O/S. Getting mixed reports there.

data.title: DirectX 11 dds skybox bugged
data.body:
I just tested out my level in DirectX 11 that has a skybox and it now looks like this:
http://duion.com/files/temp/screenshot_PB_Gummifeld025-00000.png
After some testing I found out, that this only happens in DirectX11 and if the skybox format is .dds, since the default skybox with png works.
My skybox is in .dds dxt1 format to save space and performance, but it creates this new bug, it looks like ssao corner darkening, but it has nothing to do with ssao, or maybe some other material effects are going on like specular that should not be there, or it looks like fog darkening. However I could not find a setting that makes it go away, so the issue probably has to be in the skybox material itself.

data.title: SDL2 splash.bmp screen not working
data.body:
After compiling the engine with the flag "TORQUE_SDL" to use the new SDL2 I noticed that the splash window no longer works, the one that displays the splash.bmp bitmap for better app responsiveness.
Instead the window flickers around 2 seconds after the app launch and closes again and after 4-5 seconds the app is fully loaded.
This is the function I'm talking about:
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Templates/Full/game/main.cs#L99

data.title: SDL2 app icon missing
data.body: After compiling the engine with the flag "TORQUE_SDL" so that it uses the new SDL2 I noticed that the app icon in the upper left of the window is missing and it shows a default icon instead, but otherwise the icon shows fine, like next to the executable or in desktop shortcuts.

data.title: GuiPlatformGenericMenuBar
data.body:
`tools/gui/guiPlatformGenericMenubar.ed.gui (0): Unable to instantiate non-conobject class GuiPlatformGenericMenuBar.`
This is an error message in the console that is there for quite some time now.
I don't really know what it is good for, or if it is used at all, so maybe someone here knows more.
In script it does not seem to be used, but in the source code it appears a few times in those files here:
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/tree/development/Engine/source/platformSDL/menus

data.title: Accumulation textures like (early) Sahara
data.body: As I have models with 2 textures both having a different accumulation texture, it would be nice if the accumulation feature can be applied like (early) Sahara: through the material editor. Accumulation volumes only applies an accumulation on a per object base (afaik), which does not work in the case mentioned.

data.title: Strange terrain banding
data.body:
Release 3.9:
I've noticed strange terrain banding. It seems that the banding disappears after removing the normal map of the terrainmaterial. It occurs both DX9 and DX11.

See video [here](https://youtu.be/EpLcMkk8RWg)

data.title: strip/getTrailingNumber fails with "single character+number"
data.body:
Script functions stripTrailingNumber("string") and getTrailingNumber("string") don't work correctly if the string is a single character followed by a positive number.

Examples:
Using stripTrailingNumber("t1") returns an empty string instead "t".
Using getTrailingNumber("a22") returns 0 instead of 22.

If the number is negative, both work.
("t-1" and "a-22" return correct values in the previous examples.)

A single space before the number (ex: " 11") fails for strip (empty string) but works for getTrailingNumber.
